    81class SQLClientPool

    101 MESSAGES: {
    11 POOL_NOT_OPEN: "The pool is not open; please call 'open' before invoking this method."
    12 TOO_MANY_RETURNED: "More clients have been returned to the pool than were active. A client may have been returned twice."
    13 EXHAUSTED: "The maxiumum number of clients are already active; cannot obtain a new client."
    14 MAX_WAIT: "The maxiumum number of clients are already active and the maximum wait time has been exceeded; cannot obtain a new client."
    15 INVALID: "Unable to create a valid client."
    16 INTERNAL_ERROR: "Internal error."
    17 INVALID_ARGUMENT: "Invalid argument."
    18 NULL_RETURNED: "A null object was returned."
    19 CLOSED_WITH_ACTIVE: "The pool was closed, but some clients remain active (were never returned)."
    20 }

    22 DEFAULT_WAIT_INTERVAL: 50

    147 _config:(opts,callback)=>

    41class SQLRunner
    5
    61 stop_on_error: false
    7
    8 constructor:(client=null,options={})->
    90 if client? and not options? and not client.execute?
    100 options = client
    110 client = null
    120 if not client? and options?.client?
    130 client = options.client
    140 options.client = null
    150 if options?
    160 for f in ['stop_on_error']
    170 this[f] = options[f] if options[f]
    180 if client?
    190 @set_client(client)
    20
    21 set_client:(client)=>
    220 @client = client
    23
    24 close:(callback)=>
    250 if @client?
    260 @client.disconnect(callback)
    27 else
    280 callback?()
    29
    30 execute:(sql,callback)->
    310 responses = []
    320 error = null
    330 if Array.isArray(sql)
    340 action = (stmt,index,list,next)=>
    350 @client.execute stmt, (err,tail...)=>
    360 responses.push [err].concat(tail)
    370 if err?
    380 error = err
    390 if stop_on_error
    400 callback(error,responses)
    41 else
    420 next()
    43 else
    440 next()
    450 when_done = ()=>
    460 callback(error,responses)
    470 Util.for_each_async(sql,action,when_done)
    48 else
    490 @client.execute(sql,callback)
    50
    51 execute_file:(file,encoding,callback)=>

    530 callback = encoding

    560 options.encoding = encoding if encoding?

    580 unless Util.handle_error(err,callback)
    590 execute(data.toString(),callback)
    60
    61 _BASE_OPTIONS: {
    62 h: { alias: 'help', boolean:true, describe: "Show help" }
    63 v: { alias: 'verbose', boolean:true, describe: "Be more chatty." }
    64 q: { alias: 'quiet', boolean:true, describe: "Be less chatty." }
    65 'stop-on-error': { alias: 'stop_on_error', boolean:true, describe: "Stop on error" }
    66 }
    67
    68 _get_options:(additional={})=>
    690 Util.merge(@_BASE_OPTIONS,additional)
    70
    71 _handle_argv:(argv)=>
    720 argv.v = argv.verbose = false if argv.quiet
    730 return argv
    74
    75 _stringify_results:(results...)=>
    760 return JSON.stringify(results,null,2)
    77
    78 main:(argv,logfn,errfn,callback)=>
    79 # set default arguments
    800 if errfn? and not callback?
    810 callback = errfn
    820 errfn = null
    830 if logfn? and not callback?
    840 callback = lognf
    850 logfn = null
    860 argv ?= process.argv
    870 logfn ?= console.log
    880 errfn ?= console.error
    890 callback ?= process.exit
    90 # swap out process.argv so that optimist reads the function argument
    910 original_argv = process.argv
    920 process.argv = argv
    93 # perform the rest of the operation in a try block so we can be
    94 # sure to restore process.argv when we're finished.
    950 try
    96 # read command line parameters using node-optimist
    970 optimist = require('optimist')
    980 argv = optimist.usage('Usage: $0 ...', @_get_options()).argv
    990 argv = @_handle_argv(argv)
    100 # handle help
    1010 if argv.help
    1020 optimist.showHelp(errfn)
    1030 callback()
    104 else
    105 # make sure we've got a client to run with
    1060 unless @client
    1070 errfn("SQLClient not configured.") unless argv.quiet
    1080 callback(3)
    109 else
    110 # read input files or stdin using node-argf
    1110 ARGF = require('argf')
    1120 argf = new ARGF(argv._)
    113 # after all data has been read, execute the input sql
    1140 argf.on 'finished', ()=>
    1150 sql = buffer.join("\n")
    1160 if argv.verbose
    1170 logfn "Read #{sql.length} character(s) in #{buffer.length} line(s)."
    1180 if sql.length is 0
    1190 unless argv.quiet
    1200 errfn "No input found. Cannot continue. (Try --help for help.)"
    1210 callback(2)
    122 else
    1230 if argv.verbose
    1240 logfn "Executing."
    1250 @execute sql,(err,result...)=>
    1260 if err?
    1270 unless argv.quiet
    1280 errfn "ERROR" if argv.verbose
    1290 errfn "Encountered error:",err
    1300 errfn "while executing SQL:\n",sql
    1310 callback(1)
    132 else
    1330 logfn "SUCCESS" if argv.verbose
    1340 unless argv.quiet
    1350 logfn(@_stringify_results(result...))
    1360 callback()
    137 # create one big buffer containing all input data
    1380 if argv.verbose
    1390 if argv._?.length > 0
    1400 logfn "Reading from #{argv._?.length} input files."
    141 else
    1420 logfn "Reading from stdin."
    1430 buffer = []
    1440 argf.forEach (line)=>
    1450 buffer.push line
    146 finally
    1470 process.argv = original_argv
    148
    1491exports.SQLRunner = SQLRunner

    111class SQLite3ConnectionFactory extends ConnectionFactory

    1311 if typeof mode is 'function' and not callback?
    1410 callback = mode
    1510 mode = null
    1611 db = null
    1711 cb = (err)=>
    1811 if err?
    190 callback(err)

    2111 callback(null,db)

    288 bindvars ?= []
    298 db.all(sql,bindvars,callback)

    101class SQLite3Runner extends SQLRunner
